resources.string: Only an international certificate was created

Your vaccination(s) unfortunately don\'t entitle you to a Dutch vaccination certificate.

Still have to get a new vaccination?
Please add a vaccination again after you’ve had yours. You will also receive a Dutch certificate then.

Had coronavirus before your first vaccination?
Then you\'re normally considered fully vaccinated with one vaccination. Retrieve your positive test result to add this to your vaccination certificate.

Your vaccination(s) unfortunately don\'t entitle you to a Dutch vaccination certificate.

Had a new vaccination?
Please retrieve your vaccination details again. You will receive a Dutch certificate.
You can try to add a paper certificate again later.
Doing so will stop the creation of your certificate. You will have to retrieve your test result again later.
Doing so will stop the creation of your certificate. You will have to retrieve your test result again later.
Doing so will stop the creation of your certificate. You will have to retrieve your details again later.
Your health matters, so does the health of others. Therefore always show your certificate to safely get access to places. Or if you\'re going on a trip.
Certificate of vaccination, recovery, or test

You can use this app to create a certificate if you:
  • Are vaccinated
  • Have recovered from coronavirus
  • Were tested and don\'t have coronavirus
Your certificate contains a QR code
The QR code on your certificate will be checked at the entrance to locations and activities. Or at the border.
QR codes for the Netherlands and abroad
The app creates QR codes for use in the Netherlands and abroad. Are you crossing the border? Then use your international QR code.
This is how the app uses your data
The privacy statement details how CoronaCheck handles your data. These are the most important points:
Your data is not centrally stored anywhere
No location data is used or saved
I have read the privacy statement and understand how CoronaCheck processes my data.
Visiting a venue within the Netherlands? Show both your Dutch QR code and your proof of identity at the entrance.
Are you abroad or planning to cross the border? Then always use the international QR code below. Please check before leaving which certificate you need.
Which certificate is needed where I’m heading?
You can create a QR code if you\'re vaccinated, if you\'ve had corona or by taking a test at an affiliated test location.
Want to retrieve your details? Login again with DigiD.
Show QR code at the entrance
Want to make a QR code? Get tested for coronavirus first.
Turn your vaccination, negative test result or recovery into a QR code.
Does the test point out you don\'t have coronavirus? Then you can use the test result to create a certificate. Please specify where you were tested.
You need a retrieval code to retrieve your test result.

The test location gives you a retrieval code with numbers and letters.

Didn\'t get a code? Or did you lose it? Contact the test location.
Enter your retrieval code. You received it from your test location.
You get a code via text or email
This QR code isn\'t valid. Scan the QR code given to you by the test location.
Point your phone at the QR code the test location gave you.
Are the details correct? This test result is retrieved from the test location. If the details are correct, you can create a certificate.

Your test result states your test result, the time of testing, and a minimum amount of personal data.<br\><br\>Your details consist of: (1) the first letter of your first name, (2) the first letter of your last name, (3) your day of birth and (4) your month of birth.

Are these details incorrect?
Please contact your test location. They can help you change these details.
Your test result not yet known. Please try again later. Is this not correct? Contact the test location.
Your test result is now being made into a QR code
That you tested negative (no coronavirus) on February 2 at 14:06 will be processed into the QR code. The CoronaCheck app only shows the anonymous QR code, without test details.
This code is invalid. A valid code looks like this: BRB-YYYYYYYYY1-Z2.
Invalid combination. Enter the 6-digit verification code.
Retrieval code is from an unknown test location
Please enter a retrieval code first
Please enter a verification code first

Please try again later.

If you have any questions, contact your test location.

CoronaCheck is created to reopen society step by step. This way, we can head out more often and travel abroad.

CoronaCheck creates a coronavirus pass from your vaccination, negative test result or if you\'ve had coronavirus and are recovered. Your coronavirus pass has a QR code. Have it scanned for access to places or activities in The Netherlands, or to travel internationally (the EU Digital COVID Certificate).

Your test result has already been retrieved. And it\'s already been made into a QR code.

Is this not correct? Contact the test location.

Your QR code has expired.
Get tested again.
CoronaCheck wants to access your camera
This is the only way the app can scan your QR code.
The app is not in use at the moment. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl/en
To continue, install the latest version of the app.
This may be because your internet connection is failing or because the server cannot be reached.
Show QR code at the entrance
You can only use test results no older than %1$s hour(s) to make a QR code.
You can only use test results no older than %1$s hour(s) to make a QR code.
Your test result has been made into a QR code

That you\'ve been tested negative (no coronavirus) on %1$s at %2$s has been processed into the QR code.

This app only shows the anonymous QR code, without any further test information.
This is where you can find an image of your QR code.
Information about your negative test result
We failed to reach the server. Can you check if you\'re connected to the internet?

We failed to reach the server. Can you check if you’re connected to the internet?

Error code:
%1s

Vaccination certificate
Have you been vaccinated? You can now retrieve your vaccination certificate in the app. And make a QR code of it. This gives you access to certain locations or activities. You\'ll also get a QR code to travel internationally.
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You can\'t access the CoronaCheck app without agreeing to the updated terms.
You receive the verification code via text or email. Didn\'t get one? Click ‘send again’ below for a new code.
Enter your verification code to retrieve your negative test result.
Beware: your device is rooted. Your data may not be secure.
What would you like to add?
Indicate what you would like to add to your certificate.
The test proves I do not have coronavirus
Did you receive a (booster) vaccination? Log in using DigiD to retrieve all your vaccination details.
Are the details correct? If the details about your vaccination are correct, you can create a certificate.
Always use your Dutch QR code within the Netherlands. Travelling outside the Netherlands? Then use your international QR code.
The Dutch QR code only contains your initials, your birth month, and your day of birth.
The international QR code contains the following details: your name, date of birth, and information about the vaccine.
Please contact your test location. They can help you change these details.

Your Dutch QR code contains minimal information. While it states that your certificate is valid, it doesn\'t specify if you\'ve been tested, recovered or vaccinated.

The QR code also contains the first letter of your first and last name and your date and month of birth. This is to make sure the QR code belongs to you.

Your information*: %1$s

* Information can sometimes disappear to protect your privacy. In that case, you will see a dash (_).
Are you abroad, or planning to cross the border? This requires more data. That\'s why the international QR code contains the following details:
Are you abroad, or planning to cross the border? This requires more data. That\'s why the international QR code contains the following details:

The following details were retrieved at the test location:Your details: %1$s
Test type: %2$s
Test date: %3$s
Test result: %4$s
Unique test identifier: %5$s
The following details were retrieved at the test location:

The following details of your vaccination were retrieved:

Name: %1$s
Date of birth*: %2$s

Disease targeted: %3$s
Vaccine: %4$s
Vaccine medicinal product: %5$s
Vaccine manufacturer: %6$s
Number in series of doses: %7$s
Is this the last dose of your vaccination? %8$s
Date of vaccination*: %9$s
Member state of vaccination: %10$s
Unique certificate identifier: %11$s
These details about your vaccination were retrieved from %1$s:
Is this the last dose of your vaccination?
Your %1$s isn\'t valid internationally. You\'ve only got a Dutch certificate.

Your test certificate isn\'t valid in the Netherlands. That\'s why only an international certificate was made.

It\'s possible the validity period in the Netherlands is shorter than the validity period in other countries. Get tested again.

Your vaccination certificate isn\'t valid in the Netherlands. That\'s why only an international certificate was made.
It\'s possible you\'ve only had one injection. Add your second vaccination to get a valid Dutch certificate. Read all about the possible causes.

Your test certificate isn\'t valid internationally. That\'s why only a Dutch certificate was created.

It\'s possible that your type of test isn\'t accepted abroad. Please get tested again.

Your vaccination certificate isn\'t valid internationally. That\'s why only a Dutch certificate was made.

It\'s possible your type of vaccination isn\'t accepted abroad.
At this moment, we can\'t make a certificate from your %1$s. This can have various causes. Find more information on the Guidepost.

There is no available vaccination data. This can have various causes. Read the Guidepost for more information.

Got vaccinated recently? It can take a few hours until your details are available. Try again later.

There is no available data of your test result. This can have various causes. Read the Guidepost for more information.

Already got a negative test result from the GGD? It can take a few hours until your details are available. Try again later.
For a test certificate, you must take a test first at an affiliated test location. Does the test prove you don\'t have coronavirus? Then you can make a certificate.
The QR code contains a minimum amount of personal data.
There are currently many visitors on the affiliated partner\'s website. We can\'t retrieve your details now. Please try again later.
Something went wrong with the server of your test or injection location. Please try again later.
Contact our helpdesk and give them error code (%1$s) or try again later.
Due to increased traffic or an outage at one of the parties, some details may be missing. Please try again later.
Please contact the care provider who vaccinated you. This can be the GGD, your general practitioner, or a doctor belonging to a healthcare facility. They can help you change these details.

\"The QR code sometimes needs an internet connection. Without an internet connection, your QR code can be used for 3 more days. When you’re connected, you’ll be able to use the QR code again for a longer period of time.\"
You need an internet connection to regain access to your QR code.

From now on, you can create a certificate of recovery using this app. This is proof you have had a positive test result. You can use it to show you’ve had coronavirus. This way you gain access to certain locations and activities. You may also use it to travel internationally.
Are the details correct? If the details about your test are correct, you can create a certificate.
Have you had coronavirus? Then you can make a recovery certificate of the positive test result. Log in with DigiD to retrieve your test result.

Have you just been tested? It may take a few hours before your result is available. Please try again later.

Were you tested longer ago? Find more information on the Guidepost.
The test proves I have had coronavirus
The following details were retrieved at the test location:
Are you abroad, or planning to cross the border? This requires more data. That\'s why the international QR code contains the following details:

Your recovery certificate isn\'t valid in the Netherlands, because the type of test is not accepted.

You’ve only got an international QR code.

Your recovery certificate isn\'t valid internationally. You\'ve only got a Dutch certificate.

The reason could be that the type of test is not accepted, or that the test is no longer valid abroad. An international recovery certificate can only be made with a PCR-test that is less than 180 days old. Read more about the possible causes on the Guidepost.
The app periodically needs a connection to the server to refresh your QR codes. We failed to reach the server because of an error. Try again

Sorry, we weren’t able to refresh your QR code. Open the app again in 10 minutes.

Still not working? Please call the help desk at 0800-1421 (free) and provide the following error code: A 075

Connect to the internet to make sure your QR code works again.
Try again
You’ve wrongly received a Dutch vaccination certificate due to a technical error. This was corrected.
Something went wrong while refreshing your details
Please retrieve your details again via the app.
Find your Dutch certificate here later
Find your international certificate here later
You can add a certificate if you\'re vaccinated, if you\'ve had coronavirus or by taking a test at an affiliated test location.
Are you abroad, or planning to cross the border? Then always use your international certificate. Please check before leaving which certificate you need.
Which certificate is needed where I\'m heading?
Please enter the letter combination. You’ve received this together with the paper certificate.
This letter combination is invalid. A valid combination looks like this: FLBRXQ.
Please enter a letter combination first

Then you won\'t be able to add your certificates to the app this way.

You only have a letter combination if you requested your paper certificates from your healthcare provider, or had them delivered by mail.

Did you print your certificate yourself?
Then you can add your certificates to the app using DigiD.
You can add paper certificates to the app if you received them in one of the following ways:
Your general practitioner or another healthcare provider has printed your certificates for you
The government has printed your certificates for you and sent them by mail

Then you won\'t be able to add your certificates to the app this way.

However, you can add certificates to the app using DigiD.

Did you print your certificate yourself?
Please add your certificate to the app via the menu. Go to “Add certificate” and log in using your DigiD.

Use your phone\'s camera to scan the international QR code on your paper certificate.

Do you have multiple international QR codes? Please retake these steps for every QR code you want to add to the app.
Point your phone at the QR code on the international certificate
Scan the QR code on your international certificate. You don\'t have to scan the Dutch QR code.
This QR code isn\'t valid. Scan the QR code on your international certificate.

This paper certificate is no longer valid. This may have various causes:
  • Your vaccination or recovery certificate is still valid, but the paper certificate isn’t. Please request a new paper coronavirus pass from the healthcare provider who vaccinated or tested you.
  • Your vaccination or recovery has expired.

For safety reasons, you won\'t be able to add this QR code to the app temporarily.

You can try again after 24 hours.
This letter combination and QR code don\'t belong together.
We can\'t add a certificate on your phone

Your phone doesn\'t have a camera. This means you cannot scan the paper certificate and add it to your phone.

Please use the paper certificate you received from the healthcare provider.
You can create a certificate with these details.
Are you sure you want to go back?
Doing so will stop the process of adding a certificate.

The personal details you just retrieved don\'t match those in your current certificate. You can either stop and have your details changed by the organisation that registered the details for your certificate, or replace your certificate. Your current certificate will then be removed.
Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport
A Dutch and an international tab

From now on you can easily switch between your Dutch and international certificate. At the top of the screen, you’ll find a tab named ‘the Netherlands’ and a tab named ‘International’. Are you travelling abroad? Use the certificates found under ‘International’.
Check your phone\'s time settings. They might be incorrect.

In order to properly use the CoronaCheck app, it is important that the time on your phone is set correctly. For example, if the clock on your phone is a few minutes ahead, an error might occur while verifying your coronavirus pass.

Go to your phone\'s settings and set the date and time to \'set automatically\'.
Want to prevent having to update when you\'re entering a place, or crossing the border? Then update to a newer version now.

We are working hard to solve this problem. Could you please try again later?

Error code:
%1s

Something is going wrong while creating your certificate. Could you please try again later?

Error code:
%1s

Something is going wrong while creating your certificate. Could you please try again later?

Error code:
%1s
Are these all your recovery certificates?
Due to increased traffic or an outage, some of your details may be missing. Are you missing a vaccination? Please come back later and retrieve your details again.
The healthcare provider who vaccinated or tested you can help you further. Contact them and let them know the CoronaCheck app couldn’t find a social security number.
You’ve waited too long. For safety reasons, you were logged out. Login again with your DigiD to retrieve your details.
Please note that your device is not protected by PIN or other security measures. This means others might see your data and your details may not be secure.
This QR code is not yet valid everywhere. In which case, use one from a previous dose.
You probably won\'t need this QR code because you have a more recent dose.
You can renew your international vaccination certificate

Soon we will renew everyone\'s vaccination certificate. As a result, you\'ll get access to QR codes of earlier vaccinations.

This can be useful for people who want to go to a place where their latest vaccination is not yet valid.

If you want to, you can also renew your certificate now.
Your international vaccination certificate has been renewed

We have renewed everyone\'s vaccination certificate. From now on, you have access to QR codes of earlier vaccinations.

This can be useful for people who want to go to a place where their latest vaccination is not yet valid.

Read more about your renewed vaccination certificate here.
Please connect to the internet soon

Every now and then, the CoronaCheck app needs an internet connection to keep working. Without internet, your app will keep working until %1s. Open the app once you have an internet connection. It will automatically work again.

Please connect regularly to prevent any problems.
No internet browser was found on this phone to open %1s. Download a browser to open the link.
Clearing will delete all data and certificates from the app and will close the app. You can simply restart it afterwards.
Positive test result no longer valid

It has been too long ago since you tested positive for coronavirus. Therefore, your test result is no longer valid. Unfortunately, you cannot create a recovery certificate.

Find more information on the Guidepost.
You can use the details in international QR codes to immediately create a Dutch certificate as well. This way you won\'t have to scan them both.

Your vaccination(s) unfortunately don\'t entitle you to a Dutch vaccination certificate.

Still have to get a new vaccination?
Please add a vaccination again after you’ve had yours. You will also receive a Dutch certificate then.

Had coronavirus before your first vaccination?
Then you\'re normally considered fully vaccinated with one vaccination. Retrieve your positive test result to add this to your vaccination certificate.
Only an international certificate was created
You don\'t have a Dutch vaccination certificate
Your vaccination(s) unfortunately don\'t entitle you to a Dutch vaccination certificate.

Had a new vaccination?
Please retrieve your vaccination details again. You will receive a Dutch certificate.

Had coronavirus before your first vaccination?
Then you\'re normally considered fully vaccinated with one vaccination. Retrieve your positive test result to add this to your vaccination certificate.

Want to know more?
Find more information on this page about the requirements and validity of the vaccination certificate.

A Dutch vaccination certificate has been created.

Your positive test result was suitable for creating a recovery certificate as well.

You tested positive after your first vaccination. Your test result is therefore not suitable for creating a Dutch vaccination certificate. However, a recovery certificate has been created.

Check the the frequently asked questions for more information.
Positive test result is not suitable

You were tested positive after your first vaccination. Your test result is therefore not suitable for creating a Dutch certificate.

Check the frequently asked questions for more information.
Retrieve details about your positive test
Log in with DigiD. Details about your positive test will be retrieved automatically.
Tip: Prevent the spread of coronavirus, use CoronaMelder too.
Vaccination certificate instead of recovery certificate

You were tested positive for coronavirus too long ago. That is why your test result is no longer valid for creating a recovery certificate.

Because you were tested positive before your first vaccination, one shot means you’re fully vaccinated. Therefore, a full vaccination certificate has been created instead.

For more information, please check the Guidepost.

A recovery certificate has been created.

Because you were tested positive before your first vaccination, one shot means you\'re fully vaccinated. Therefore, a full vaccination certificate has been created as well.
These details are in your paper certificate:

Are your details incorrect?
Please contact the healthcare provider who vaccinated or tested you. This can be the GGD, your general practitioner or doctor. They can help you change these details.
Your test certificate is only valid for 3G access within the Netherlands
Test certificate only valid for 3G access

A Dutch test certificate is only valid in places with 3G access. This means that you cannot use your test certificate to get access to places with 2G access.

What is the difference between 3G and 2G?
The Gs determine which people can be given access: only those who were vaccinated and/or have recovered (2G), or people who tested negative as well (3G).

• 3G access means you can enter places with a test, vaccination or recovery certificate.
• 2G access means you cannot enter places with a test certificate. You\'ll need a vaccination or recovery certificate.

You can read more about 3G and 2G here.
Wanneer je in Nederland woont kan je een DigiD aanvragen.<br\><br\>Woon je in Caribisch Nederland? Dan kan je inloggen met MijnCN.
Ik ben in Caribisch Nederland ingeschreven

Op dit moment kunnen we geen bewijs maken omdat er gegevens ontbreken.

Neem contact op met je openbaar lichaam en geef de foutcode door. Zij kunnen dan de gegevens controleren.

Foutcode:
%1s

Openbaar lichaam Sint Bonaire

Openbaar lichaam Sint Eustatius

Openbaar lichaam Sint Saba

Your Dutch QR code says you have a valid certificate for 1G access, and contains minimal data.

The scanner sees only the first letter of your first and last name, and your date and month of birth. This is to make sure the QR code belongs to you.

Your information*: %1$s

* Information can sometimes disappear to protect your privacy. In that case, you will see a dash (_).
No internet browser was found on this phone to open DigiD. Download a browser to open the link.
Is your result in? Log in with DigiD to retrieve your test result from the GGD.
You can update your app to a newer version now
The validity of coronavirus passes will be adjusted
Please enter an approval code first
This test location is not known to us. Please contact the location who tested you.
Invalid combination. Enter the 6-digit verification code.

There are no details available about your vaccination approval. Please go back to the desk that reviewed your vaccination.

For more information, please visit www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.
Enter your verification code. You will receive this via text or email.

You will receive an approval code on paper from the desk that reviewed your vaccination. Don\'t have an approval code? Please go back to the desk you stopped by.

Didn’t stop by a desk yet to have your vaccination reviewed? For more information, please visit www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.
Enter your approval code. You received this code from the desk that reviewed your vaccination.

Were you vaccinated outside of the European Union, and are you visiting the Netherlands? Then you can use your vaccination approval and negative test result to create a visitor pass.

You can use your visitor pass to get access to places and activities in the Netherlands that require a coronavirus pass.

For more information, please visit www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.

Please go back to the desk that reviewed your vaccination. They can re-enter your details. You will also receive a new approval code. For more information, please visit www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.
Doing so will stop the addition of your vaccination approval and you will have to retrieve your details again later.
This code is invalid. A valid code looks like this: VAC-YYYYYYYYY1-F2.
Are the details correct? If the details are correct, you can add your vaccination approval to the app.

Retrieve a negative test result to complete your visitor pass.

Didn\'t do a test yet? Make an appointment at www.testenvoortoegang.org.
Your vaccination approval has been added. Complete your visitor pass with your negative test result
Your visitor pass isn’t valid outside of the Netherlands

Your visitor pass is only valid in the Netherlands. Want to visit another country? Then please check the rules of the country you\'re planning to visit.

Want to know more?
Read more on www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.

A visitor pass is valid up until %d days after review of your vaccination. Are you staying in the Netherlands longer? Then you can request a visitor pass again. For more information, please visit www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.
Your Dutch vaccination certificate has expired
Your Dutch recovery certificate has expired
Your Dutch test certificate has expired
Your international vaccination certificate has expired
Your international recovery certificate has expired
Your international test certificate has expired
Did you receive a booster vaccination? Please retrieve your details again if you want to add it to your certificate

To renew your vaccination certificate, you need a booster vaccination. For more information about booster vaccinations, please visit www.government.nl/boosterjab.

Did you receive a booster vaccination? Then please retrieve your details again to add it to your certificate.

Your negative test result was successfully added. Add your vaccination approval to complete your visitor pass.

To this end, you\'ve received an approval code from the desk that reviewed your vaccination. You\'ve received this code on paper.
A Dutch certificate currently gives you 3G access. This means a certificate is valid anywhere a coronavirus pass is required.
Visiting a venue in The Netherlands? Check in advance whether you need a certificate for 3G or 1G access.
The access rules in the Netherlands have changed. There are now separate certificates for venues with 3G access and 1G access.
Check in advance whether you need a certificate for 3G or 1G access. Also show your proof of identity at the entrance.
In the Netherlands, you only get access with a test certificate anywhere a coronavirus pass is required (1G access).
You can add a certificate for 1G access when you have tested negative
Show a certificate for 1G access in the Netherlands if a coronavirus pass is required. Also show your proof of identity.
This certificate is currently not used in the Netherlands
The access rules in the Netherlands have changed. 3G access applies anywhere a coronavirus pass is required. This means you can enter with a vaccination, recovery, or test certificate.

The access rules in the Netherlands have changed. You can enter venues with 3G access with a vaccination, recovery, or test certificate. Venues with 1G access you can only enter with a test certificate. The app creates separate certificates for 3G and 1G access.

The access rules in the Netherlands have changed. 1G access applies anywhere a coronavirus pass is required. This means you can only enter these places with a test certificate. You can still add a vaccination or recovery certificate in the app, but you can only use these certificates abroad.
Haal ook mijn positieve testuitslag op
Als de gegevens kloppen kun je een bewijs maken.
You can create a certificate with these details.

Alleen een internationaal vaccinatiebewijs
Je hebt geen recht op een Nederlands vaccinatiebewijs. Hiervoor moet je volledig gevaccineerd zijn, of hersteld van corona vóór je eerste prik.

Herstelbewijs
Van je positieve testuitslag kon ook een Nederlands en internationaal herstelbewijs gemaakt worden.
If the details about your test are correct, you can create a recovery certificate.
This test result is retrieved from the test location. If the details are correct, you can create a certificate.
If the details are correct, you can add your vaccination approval to the app.
Neem contact op met de zorgverlener waar je bent gevaccineerd of getest. Dat kan de GGD, je huisarts of arts van een zorginstelling zijn. Zij kunnen je helpen je gegevens aan te passen.
